column4: I need a copy of linux-image-2.6.24-17-generic to repair some packaging brokenness, but I'm not seeing it in the repos
does anyone know where I might find a package of it?
I see -16 and -18
this isn't the first time this has happened.
my /boot keeps running out of space
you cuold download the package manually off packages.ubuntu.com
and that's pretty much exactly what i was planning to do
ok so you want to rid your system of ubuntu modules 17?
can you paste the exact results when doing dpkg --force-all --purge linux-ubuntu-modules-2.6.24-17
already know to use a pastebin, but thanks for letting me know which one is generally used in this channel
that's right, which is why i would try the force-all
so that the -ubuntu-modules 17 package wouldn't complain when I try to uninstall it
i think force all will fix it, give it atry
http://paste.ubuntu.com/23147/
well this is a little tricky. you say  you have no room left on /boot to accomodate the reinstallation of -17 image?
no.  the lack of space was the entire reason I removed the old kernels
to fix this problem i would be suggesting to reinstall linux image 17, and then uninstall both at once in a clean state
Hah!  That's exactly what I was going to, but I couldn't find the linux image -17 package
ah ya. back to square one.  well i will try and find it
try cd /var/cache
and then "sudo find * | grep linux-image-2.6.24-17"
